channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Told Ally That He Is Weighing Whether to Continue in the Race
item.description: The president’s conversation is the first indication that he is seriously considering whether he can recover after a devastating performance on the debate stage in Atlanta. A White House official said the claim was false.

item.title: On the Kenya-Tanzania Border, an Elephant Hunting Ban Has Collapsed
item.description: Five bulls from the area around a Kenyan wildlife reserve have been shot and killed in Tanzania in recent months. The countries have very different conservation strategies.

item.title: What credit score do you need to buy a house?
item.description: Mortgage lenders use specific credit scores—here are the minimum scores you need for a variety of mortgage types.

item.title: Kings Battle for an Ancient Throne in Nigeria
item.description: Two men claim to be the emir of Kano, an ancient kingdom in northern Nigeria. Their struggle for power and influence is feeding into a wider competition ahead of the country’s next election.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Top U.S. Official to Hold Talks in Paris on Defusing Israel-Hezbollah Conflict
item.description: Amos Hochstein’s trip to France comes after comments by Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken that Israel had “effectively lost sovereignty” near the border with Lebanon because of attacks by Hezbollah.

item.title: Fourth of July traffic will be record-setting. Here’s how to avoid the traffic jams
item.description: Nearly 71 million people will be traveling.

item.title: How Reliant Is the U.S. on Avocados From Mexico?
item.description: A temporary halt on inspections by U.S.D.A. workers in Mexico on safety concerns highlighted how dependent the United States had become on one region for supplies of the popular fruit.

item.title: Kings Battle for an Ancient Throne in Nigeria
item.description: Two men claim to be the emir of Kano, an ancient kingdom in northern Nigeria. Their struggle for power and influence is feeding into a wider competition ahead of the country’s next election.

item.title: Looking for the coming tide of economic growth? Start here
item.description: As the world ages, businesses need to seize the potential of older workers and consumers.

item.title: 13,000 Are Ordered to Evacuate as Wildfire Spreads in Northern California
item.description: A wildfire that began in Butte County, Calif., on Tuesday morning has burned more than 3,000 acres and threatened residents of the city of Oroville.

item.title: Jamaicans prepare for the arrival of Beryl.
Elon Musk vows Bill Gates will be ‘obliterated’ if he doesn’t stop shorting Tesla
item.description: If the Optimus robot somehow catapults Tesla to Musk’s $30 trillion market cap target, bears like the Microsoft cofounder could be wiped out—but that is a big if.

item.title: They Came for Spiritual Revival, Only to Be Trapped in a Deadly Panic
item.description: Family members streamed to hospitals in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh to identify loved ones after at least 121 people — nearly all women — died in a stampede at a guru’s gathering.

item.title: They Came for Spiritual Revival, Only to Be Trapped in a Deadly Panic
item.description: Family members streamed to hospitals in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh to identify loved ones after at least 121 people — nearly all women — died in a stampede at a guru’s gathering.

item.title: Paramount merger with Skydance back on under new terms following collapse of talks
item.description: National Amusements, the family company that controls Paramount, will refer the deal to a special committee of Paramount directors for review.
